title: Ethereum's Beacon Chain updated after finality issues - Cointelegraph
summary: Ethereum's Beacon Chain was updated after experiencing finality issues on May 11 and 12, causing delays in block finalization. The issues were resolved through patches rolled out by core developers for Prysm and Teku clients. The Beacon Chain serves as the consensus layer for the Ethereum network and is designed to be resilient against such issues. Client diversity played a crucial role in ensuring live and end users could transact on the network during the issue. Teku and Prysm have released optimizations to prevent beacon nodes from consuming excessive resources. The update comes after a similar issue delayed the Goerli testnet version of Ethereum’s “Shapella” upgrade in March. Recent trading hype around memecoins has increased Ethereum’s activity and staking rewards rates.

title: Eigen What? How EigenLayer Is Putting $34B in Staked Ethereum Back to Work - Decrypt
summary: EigenLayer is a new protocol that aims to put staked Ethereum back to work by rehypothecating it to secure other, newer projects. This allows stakers to earn higher yields and provides confidence to developers that their projects will be backed by the market's second-largest crypto network. EigenLayer has raised $50 million in a Series A round and is being hailed as "the next Ethereum Meta" by some in the crypto community.

However, the trend is bearish on the local chart, with a potential fall to the $1,780-$1,790 zone if the price closes below $1,800. title: Ethereum To Explode by 50% in ‘Best-Case Scenario,’ Predicts Popular Crypto Analyst – But There’s a Catch - The Daily Hodl

However, the analyst also predicts a dip to $1,600 before the rally, and another crypto strategist shares a similar outlook. Meanwhile, the supply of Ethereum on crypto exchanges has plunged to an eight-year low. The current price of Ethereum is $1,811.

title: Changing Ethereum [ETH] gas prices and its rippling impact: All you need to know - AMBCrypto News
summary: Ethereum's gas prices have decreased, potentially attracting more users to the network. Despite this, activity on the network has declined, with a decrease in NFT trades and low gas usage. Developers have addressed the issues causing these problems, releasing a fix to prevent CPU stress and memory bloat. The price of ETH has remained relatively stable, with an increase in the velocity of ETH (frequency of trading). However, network growth has slowed, indicating a decrease in interest in new ETH addresses.

title: Ethereum Poised To Hit 35% Surge In Staking Demand – What It Means For Investors - NewsBTC
summary:
Ethereum is expected to experience a 35% surge in staking demand in 2023, according to a report by Staked, a research subsidiary of the Kraken exchange. This increase is attributed to several factors, including the recent increase in average Ethereum staking yield and the adoption of Proof of Stake (PoS) as a more secure and energy-efficient method to validate transactions and add new blocks to the blockchain.

The increased staking activity could lead to a decrease in the circulating supply of ETH, potentially driving up its price. This would benefit long-term investors who are looking to maximize their returns, as well as make the network more secure and trustworthy.

The price of ETH currently stands at $1,798, with a 2.4% rally in the past 24 hours. However, the cryptocurrency has experienced a seven-day slump of 8.5%, highlighting the volatility characteristic of the cryptocurrency market.

title: Crypto to buy now: Top investor shares the 3 to choose in May - USA TODAY
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Top investor shares three crypto to buy in May: Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Solana. Bitcoin offers the optimal blend of risk and reward, while Ethereum has a well-diversified ecosystem and is upgrading its blockchain. Solana has the potential to outperform both Bitcoin and Ethereum this year, with its recent launch of Saga and integration of crypto-friendly features. The Motley Fool recommends buying these cryptos instead of Bitcoin, which was not included in their top picks.

title: This Week in Coins: Bitcoin and Ethereum Lead Market Pullback as Dollar Rises - Decrypt
summary: Bitcoin and Ethereum saw a moderate pullback this week, with Bitcoin down 7.9% and Ethereum down 5.8%. The decline was driven by a rising dollar, which has an inverse relationship with cryptocurrencies. The use of Bitcoin for Ordinals NFTs appears to be slowing down, and transaction fees hit a brief two-year high. Other cryptocurrencies that dipped more than 8% include Polygon, Avalanche, Toncoin, and Internet Computer. In other news, American crypto exchange Bittrex filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, and lawmakers in Washington failed to find common ground over digital asset regulation. Texas lawmakers voted to update the state’s Bill of Rights to include the right to own, hold, and use digital currencies, and the U.S. Chamber of Commerce criticized the SEC’s regulatory approach towards the industry.

title: Whales Move Over $1,070,000,000 in Bitcoin, Ethereum, XRP and Polygon – Here’s Where the Crypto Is Heading - The Daily Hodl
summary: Deep-pocketed crypto investors are moving over $1 billion in Bitcoin, Ethereum, XRP, and Polygon. Whale Alert tracked $849.1 million in Bitcoin transactions, including 10,000 Bitcoin moved from one unknown wallet to another. Other notable transactions include $24.94 million in Polygon and $164.4 million in Ethereum. XRP saw a $20.95 million transaction, and a whale moved 50,000,000 XRP from Ripple to an unknown wallet. Markets are dipping, with Bitcoin trading at $26,771, Ethereum at $1,813, and XRP at $0.429.

title: Following Arbitrum (ARB)’s $120M Airdrop to DAOs, DigiToads (TOADS) Spikes in Interest Among Ethereum Whales - Crypto News Flash
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Following Arbitrum's $120M airdrop to DAOs, DigiToads (TOADS) has seen a surge in interest among Ethereum whales. TOADS has a community-first approach and has already made over $3M in sales in just a couple of months.
